statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -9 \\ -9 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 6 \\ -11 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 11 \\ 8 \\ -17 \\ 8 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -9 \\ -9 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 6 \\ -11 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 11 \\ 8 \\ -17 \\ 8 \end{array}\right].
